p: Our investigation also reported a lower seroprevalence of ebolaviruses (2.5%) than pooled seroprevalences reported in other studies in neighbouring Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) at 10% [ 19, 27– 30], Central African Republic and Gabon at 11% [ 31– 35], Sudan at 22% [ 36], Madagascar at 4% [ 11], Liberia at 13% [ 37] and Cameroon at 7% [ 38, 39]. However, our study showed higher seroprevalence than that reported in Nigeria at 2% [ 22], Germany at 1% [ 12] and Kenya at 1% [ 13]. Only one Marburg virus seropositive person was confirmed in our study and this was much lower than has been reported in other studies [ 11– 17]. However, further comparison of these studies is difficult due to differences in serological methods used and differences in filovirus species targeted.
